<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The ScalarEvolution class is an LLVM pass which can be used to analyze and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// categorize scalar expressions in loops.  It specializes in recognizing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// general induction variables, representing them with the abstract and opaque</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SCEV class.  Given this analysis, trip counts of loops and other important</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// properties can be obtained.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This analysis is primarily useful for induction variable substitution and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// strength reduction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ScalarEvolution&#39;s BumpPtrAllocator holds the data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/foldingsetnodeidref">FoldingSetNodeIDRef</a> FastID;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The SCEV baseclass this node corresponds to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad409632178dd00316abd4c35d3e14b5e">SCEVTypes</a> SCEVType;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Estimated complexity of this node&#39;s expression tree size.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">short</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This field is initialized to zero and may be used in subclasses to store</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// miscellaneous information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ade1f1b89affe842dacd20c7f950e99c9"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">short</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ade1f1b89affe842dacd20c7f950e99c9">SubclassData</a> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// NoWrapFlags are bitfield indices into SubclassData.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add and Mul expressions may have no-unsigned-wrap &lt;NUW&gt; or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// no-signed-wrap &lt;NSW&gt; properties, which are derived from the IR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operator. NSW is a misnomer that we use to mean no signed overflow or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// underflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// AddRec expressions may have a no-self-wraparound &lt;NW&gt; property if, in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the integer domain, abs(step) &#42; max-iteration(loop) &lt;=</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// unsigned-max(bitwidth).  This means that the recurrence will never reach</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// its start value if the step is non-zero.  Computing the same value on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// each iteration is not considered wrapping, and recurrences with step = 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// are trivially &lt;NW&gt;.  &lt;NW&gt; is independent of the sign of step and the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value the add recurrence starts with.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that NUW and NSW are also valid properties of a recurrence, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// either implies NW. For convenience, NW will be set for a recurrence</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// whenever either NUW or NSW are set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We require that the flag on a SCEV apply to the entire scope in which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that SCEV is defined.  A SCEV&#39;s scope is set of locations dominated by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a defining location, which is in turn described by the following rules:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#42; A SCEVUnknown is at the point of definition of the Value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#42; A SCEVConstant is defined at all points.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#42; A SCEVAddRec is defined starting with the header of the associated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#42; All other SCEVs are defined at the earlest point all operands are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   defined.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The above rules describe a maximally hoisted form (without regards to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// potential control dependence).  A SCEV is defined anywhere a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// corresponding instruction could be defined in said maximally hoisted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// form.  Note that SCEVUDivExpr (currently the only expression type which</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// can trap) can be defined per these rules in regions where it would trap</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// at runtime.  A SCEV being defined does not require the existence of any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instruction within the defined scope.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">NoWrapFlags</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa23e74052c4d79cfdaa23460a3c946656">FlagAnyWrap</a> = 0,    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No guarantee.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faf763167030e97d18e8f8c8ed3dba28e3"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faf763167030e97d18e8f8c8ed3dba28e3">FlagNW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 0),  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No self-wrap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382">FlagNUW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 1), </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No unsigned wrap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fa2f7a8775a783f7ea3ad24b3f9cb5d949">FlagNSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 2), </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No signed wrap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fae022582ed4b56bdb108b4488809e11e6"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6fae022582ed4b56bdb108b4488809e11e6">NoWrapMask</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 3) - 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">explicit</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c">SCEV</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/foldingsetnodeidref">FoldingSetNodeIDRef</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad409632178dd00316abd4c35d3e14b5e">SCEVTypes</a> SCEVTy,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlight">                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">short</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : FastID(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>), SCEVType(SCEVTy), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a4d7d3fc30d912cee99348a044b76f2a8"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a4d7d3fc30d912cee99348a044b76f2a8">SCEV</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ace7f137cfb19ce8073b78b85f819430c">SCEV</a> &amp;) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns estimated size of the mathematical expression represented by this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SCEV. The rules of its calculation are following:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) Size of a SCEV without operands (like constants and SCEVUnknown) is 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) Size SCEV with operands Op1, Op2, ..., OpN is calculated by formula:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    (1 + Size(Op1) + ... + Size(OpN)).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This value gives us an estimation of time we need to traverse through this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SCEV and all its operands recursively. We may use it to avoid performing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// heavy transformations on SCEVs of excessive size for sake of saving the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compilation time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a102c99af586cd76e0d9ff32ac0e825e0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">short</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a102c99af586cd76e0d9ff32ac0e825e0">getExpressionSize</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#aaf1d4f0b6eece16e8a081906d13a84f9">ExpressionSize</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Specialize FoldingSetTrait for SCEV to avoid needing to compute</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class represents an assumption made on an AddRec expression. Given an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// affine AddRec expression &#123;a,+,b&#125;, we assume that it has the nssw or nusw</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// flags (defined below) in the first X iterations of the loop, where X is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// SCEV expression returned by getPredicatedBackedgeTakenCount).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that this does not imply that X is equal to the backedge taken</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// count. This means that if we have a nusw predicate for i32 &#123;0,+,1&#125; with a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// predicated backedge taken count of X, we only guarantee that &#123;0,+,1&#125; has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// nusw in the first X iterations. &#123;0,+,1&#125; may still wrap in the loop if we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// have more than X iterations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a1434e18d5ff272c4b7bfb27e519dee42">SCEVWrapPredicate</a> final : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevpredicate/#a6d2a13cb997f4164ed8d17c16b50acf1">SCEVPredicate</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Similar to SCEV::NoWrapFlags, but with slightly different semantics</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// for FlagNUSW. The increment is considered to be signed, and a + b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (where b is the increment) is considered to wrap if:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    zext(a + b) != zext(a) + sext(b)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If Signed is a function that takes an n-bit tuple and maps to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// integer domain as the tuples value interpreted as twos complement,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and Unsigned a function that takes an n-bit tuple and maps to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// integer domain as the base two value of input tuple, then a + b</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// has IncrementNUSW iff:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0 &lt;= Unsigned(a) + Signed(b) &lt; 2^n</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The IncrementNSSW flag has identical semantics with SCEV::FlagNSW.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that the IncrementNUSW flag is not commutative: if base + inc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// has IncrementNUSW, then inc + base doesn&#39;t neccessarily have this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// property. The reason for this is that this is used for sign/zero</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// extending affine AddRec SCEV expressions when a SCEVWrapPredicate is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// assumed. A &#123;base,+,inc&#125; expression is already non-commutative with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// regards to base and inc, since it is interpreted as:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     (((base + inc) + inc) + inc) ...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70">IncrementWrapFlags</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a11c850531be360193c9473b4fe240c1d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a11c850531be360193c9473b4fe240c1d">IncrementAnyWrap</a> = 0,     </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No guarantee.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a17e825823d4b6a92c1b221c4460c91a3"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70a17e825823d4b6a92c1b221c4460c91a3">IncrementNUSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 0), </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No unsigned with signed increment wrap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70aa4c321f736f542d50b81bb06351f7fce"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevwrappredicate/#a0cfd938ff9c572d287e5e7923624db70aa4c321f736f542d50b81bb06351f7fce">IncrementNSSW</a> = (1 &lt;&lt; 1), </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// No signed with signed increment wrap</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (equivalent with SCEV::NSW)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns a wider type among &#123;Ty1, Ty2&#125;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a10cde7087f90dc664b6799814aa28584">getWiderType</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty1, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty2) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if there exists a point in the program at which both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A and B could be operands to the same instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SCEV expressions are generally assumed to correspond to instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// which could exists in IR.  In general, this requires that there exists</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a use point in the program where all operands dominate the use.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     loop &#123; v1 = load @global1; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     loop &#123; v2 = load @global2; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="698"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="699"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Compute ceil(N / D). N and D are treated as unsigned values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="700"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="701"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Since SCEV doesn&#39;t have native ceiling division, this generates a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="702"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// SCEV expression of the following form:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="703"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="704"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// umin(N, 1) + floor((N - umin(N, 1)) / D)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Convert from an &quot;exit count&quot; (i.e. &quot;backedge taken count&quot;) to a &quot;trip</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// count&quot;.  A &quot;trip count&quot; is the number of times the header of the loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will execute if an exit is taken after the specified number of backedges</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// have been taken.  (e.g. TripCount = ExitCount + 1).  Note that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// expression can overflow if ExitCount = UINT&#95;MAX.  If EvalTy is not wide</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// enough to hold the result without overflow, result unsigned wraps with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2s-complement semantics.  ex: EC = 255 (i8), TC = 0 (i8)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a3e3935d45c4b79b85a117b47cc1d2e61">getTripCountFromExitCount</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ExitCount, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;EvalTy,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns the exact trip count of the loop if we can compute it, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the result is a small constant.  &#39;0&#39; is used to represent an unknown</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// or non-constant trip count.  Note that a trip count is simply one more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// than the backedge taken count for the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#abec0c616087c002528fcf80c6583eadd">getSmallConstantTripCount</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return the exact trip count for this loop if we exit through ExitingBlock.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#39;0&#39; is used to represent an unknown or non-constant trip count.  Note</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// that a trip count is simply one more than the backedge taken count for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the same exit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This &quot;trip count&quot; assumes that control exits via ExitingBlock. More</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// precisely, it is the number of times that control will reach ExitingBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// before taking the branch. For loops with multiple exits, it may not be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the number times that the loop header executes if the loop exits</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// prematurely via another branch.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#abec0c616087c002528fcf80c6583eadd">getSmallConstantTripCount</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// value.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The terms &quot;backedge taken count&quot; and &quot;exit count&quot; are used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// interchangeably to refer to the number of times the backedge of a loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// has executed before the loop is exited.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ace535ba3b8cc110f49b5db48a945ecef">ExitCountKind</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return the number of times the backedge executes before the given exit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// would be taken; if not exactly computable, return SCEVCouldNotCompute.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For a single exit loop, this value is equivelent to the result of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// getBackedgeTakenCount.  The loop is guaranteed to exit (via &#42;some&#42; exit)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the specified loop has a predictable backedge-taken count, return it,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// otherwise return a SCEVCouldNotCompute object. The backedge-taken count is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// one less than the trip count of the loop, since it doesn&#39;t count the first</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// iteration, when the header is branched to from outside the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that it is not valid to call this method on a loop without a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop-invariant backedge-taken count (see</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Similar to getBackedgeTakenCount, except it will add a set of</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="910"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// When successful, this returns a SCEV that is greater than or equal</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#a20c66c97bae0b3e6725d03cfa61c488b">isKnownNonZero</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Test if the given expression is known to be a power of 2  OrNegative</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// allows matching negative power of 2s, and OrZero allows matching 0</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#aa5e7bb544eab3ac6fa1f810ee068ab6b">isKnownToBeAPowerOfTwo</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OrZero = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><span class="doxyHighlight">                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> OrNegative = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Splits SCEV expression \\p S into two SCEVs. One of them is obtained from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\p S by substitution of all AddRec sub-expression related to loop \\p L</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// with initial value of that SCEV. The second is obtained from \\p S by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// substitution of all AddRec sub-expressions related to loop \\p L with post</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// increment of this AddRec in the loop \\p L. In both cases all other AddRec</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// sub-expressions (not related to \\p L) remain the same.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the \\p S contains non-invariant unknown SCEV the function returns</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// CouldNotCompute SCEV in both values of std::pair.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For example, for SCEV S=&#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt; and loop L=L1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the function returns pair:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// first = &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// second = &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; + &#123;0, +, 1&#125;&lt;L2&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We can see that for the first AddRec sub-expression it was replaced with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 0 (initial value) for the first element and to &#123;1, +, 1&#125;&lt;L1&gt; (post</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// increment value) for the second one. In both cases AddRec expression</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// related to L2 remains the same.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::pair&lt;const SCEV &#42;, const SCEV &#42;&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#ae7a40d693574be8048944e80774e6c1d">SplitIntoInitAndPostInc</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;L,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;S);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// We&#39;d like to check the predicate on every iteration of the most dominated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// loop between loops used in LHS and RHS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// To do this we use the following list of steps:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1 Collect set S all loops on which either LHS or RHS depend.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2 If S is non-empty</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a. Let PD be the element of S which is dominated by all other elements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// b. Let E(LHS) be value of LHS on entry of PD.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    To get E(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    attached to PD on with their entry values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    Define E(RHS) in the same way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// c. Let B(LHS) be value of L on backedge of PD.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    To get B(LHS), we should just take LHS and replace all AddRecs that are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    attached to PD on with their backedge values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    Define B(RHS) in the same way.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// d. Note that E(LHS) and E(RHS) are automatically available on entry of PD,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    so we can assert on that.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// e. Return true if isLoopEntryGuardedByCond(Pred, E(LHS), E(RHS)) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                   isLoopBackedgeGuardedByCond(Pred, B(LHS), B(RHS))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#afd0a71dc4e0ed5b83c50e875e6726661">isKnownViaInduction</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmppredicate">CmpPredicate</a> Pred, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Test if the given expression is known to satisfy the condition described</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// by Pred, LHS, and RHS.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution/#af74112dae88db73eb5484821b6f0fccd">isKnownPredicate</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmppredicate">CmpPredicate</a> Pred, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Information about the number of loop iterations for which a loop exit&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// branch condition evaluates to the not-taken path.  This is a temporary</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ExitNotTakenInfo and BackedgeTakenInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#a1e319052f7cf5f2d9769db4ed04694ce">ExitLimit</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#a5012e3204345ebea8f21e6e164fb49c4"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#a5012e3204345ebea8f21e6e164fb49c4">ExactNotTaken</a>; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The exit is not taken exactly this many times</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#adc011a87f2cd47a6f31f6f11a3b7e912"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#adc011a87f2cd47a6f31f6f11a3b7e912">ConstantMaxNotTaken</a>; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The exit is not taken at most this many</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#a03d7d0132bc51cf40d61a76298d5e70a"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/scalarevolution/exitlimit/#a03d7d0132bc51cf40d61a76298d5e70a">MaxOrZero</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Construct either an exact exit limit from a constant, or an unknown</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1573"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Return an expression indicating the exact &#42;backedge-taken&#42;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// otherwise.  If execution makes it to the backedge on every</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// iteration (i.e. there are no abnormal exists like exception</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   idx0 = a + b;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   ptr&#91;idx0&#93; = 100;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   if (&lt;condition&gt;) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     idx1 = a +nsw b;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     ptr&#91;idx1&#93; = 200;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// where the SCEV expression (+ a b) is guaranteed to not be poison (and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// hence not sign-overflow) only if &quot;&lt;condition&gt;&quot; is true.  Since both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#96;idx0&#96; and &#96;idx1&#96; will be mapped to the same SCEV expression, (+ a b),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it is not okay to annotate (+ a b) with &lt;nsw&gt; in the above example.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> isSCEVExprNeverPoison(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This is like \\c isSCEVExprNeverPoison but it specifically works for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instructions that will get mapped to SCEV add recurrences.  Return true</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if \\p I will never generate poison under the assumption that \\p I is an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// add recurrence on the loop \\p L.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> isAddRecNeverPoison(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Loop &#42;L);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2216"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Similar to createAddRecFromPHI, but with the additional flexibility of</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2224"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If the analysis is not successful, a mapping from the \\p SymbolicPHI to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2369"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2370"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// An interface layer with SCEV used to manage how we see SCEV expressions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2371"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for values in the context of existing predicates. We can add new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2372"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// predicates, but we cannot remove them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2373"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2374"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This layer has multiple purposes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2375"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - provides a simple interface for SCEV versioning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2376"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - guarantees that the order of transformations applied on a SCEV</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2377"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     expression for a single Value is consistent across two different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2378"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     getSCEV calls. This means that, for example, once we&#39;ve obtained</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02379" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2379"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     an AddRec expression for a certain value through expression</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02380" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2380"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     rewriting, we will continue to get an AddRec expression for that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02381" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2381"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02382" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2382"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - lowers the number of expression rewrites.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2383" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#aa2b11e914798a4e54c7e640722f1b08d">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2384"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2385"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#aa2b11e914798a4e54c7e640722f1b08d">PredicatedScalarEvolution</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &amp;L);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2391"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returned by ScalarEvolution is guaranteed to be preserved, even when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2392"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// adding new predicates.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2393"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/predicatedscalarevolution/#ae0994d8207b94ad22ecebc1a6bc580f1">getSCEV</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V);</span></CodeLine>
